item.title: Trump walks back Chicago 'war' threat, but vows to 'clean up' cities
item.description: Trump posted online that Chicago was "about to find out why it's called the Department of WAR," but later said his administration wouldn't go to war with American cities but rather "clean them up."

item.title: Colombia's lone Amazon port faces drying river and rising tensions with Peru
item.description: Colombia's only Amazon port town could soon be cut off from the river that keeps it alive. As drought and a shifting river spark a tense border dispute with Peru, locals are scrambling to adapt—and politicians are raising flags, literally.

item.title: South Korea says it has reached a deal with the US for the release of workers in a Georgia plant
item.description: More than 300 South Korean workers were detained in an immigration raid on Thursday. Presidential chief of staff Kang Hoon-sik said South Korea plans to send a charter plane to bring the workers home.

item.title: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba to resign
